intro: Parietaria platyphyllos, commonly known as the broad-leaf wall-rocket, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of broad, fleshy leaves and small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. The plant is native to southern Europe and is often found growing in disturbed soils and along roadsides. It produces small, edible seeds that are sometimes used in salads. The species is notable for its ability to thrive in urban environments and its role in supporting local pollinators.
